mageGuild1.name: Circle of Elders I
mageGuild1.description: Allows your heroes to learn 1st level spells. Ancient shamans gather here to channel primal magic.

mageGuild2.name: Circle of Elders II
mageGuild2.description: Allows your heroes to learn 2nd level spells. The shamans delve deeper into the mysteries of the primeval world.

mageGuild3.name: Circle of Elders III
mageGuild3.description: Allows your heroes to learn 3rd level spells. Volcanic energy fuels the shamans' growing power.

mageGuild4.name: Circle of Elders IV
mageGuild4.description: Allows your heroes to learn 4th level spells. Only the most powerful shamans can wield these ancient incantations.

tavern.name: Watering Hole
tavern.description: A gathering place where heroes come to be recruited. Dinosaurs and warriors alike converge at this ancient oasis.

fort.name: Fort
fort.description: Provides basic town defenses and allows creature recruitment from built dwellings. Wooden palisades reinforced with dinosaur bone.

citadel.name: Citadel
citadel.description: Strengthens town defenses with a central tower and increases creature growth by 50%. The walls are lined with fossilized armor plates.

castle.name: Castle
castle.description: Provides full fortifications with arrow towers, a moat, and doubles creature growth. A fortress of stone and bone worthy of the mightiest saurians.

villageHall.name: Village Hall
villageHall.description: The basic administrative center of the town. Produces 500 gold per day.

townHall.name: Town Hall
townHall.description: An improved administrative center. Produces 1000 gold per day.

cityHall.name: City Hall
cityHall.description: A grand hall of governance. Produces 2000 gold per day.

capitol.name: Capitol
capitol.description: The seat of supreme power. Produces 4000 gold per day. Only one capitol may exist per player.

marketplace.name: Trading Grounds
marketplace.description: Allows resource trading. Dinosaur herders and scavengers barter goods beneath the canopy of giant ferns.

resourceSilo.name: Sulfur Vent
resourceSilo.description: Produces 1 sulfur per day. A volcanic fissure harnessed to extract precious sulfur from deep within the earth.

blacksmith.name: Fossil Forge
blacksmith.description: Allows heroes to purchase basic war machines. Weapons and armor are crafted from fossilized bone and volcanic glass.

horde1.name: Breeding Grounds
horde1.description: Increases raptor growth by 2 per week. A carefully managed nesting area where raptors breed and hatch under watchful eyes.

grail.name: Heart of Pangaea
grail.description: The ultimate artifact of prehistoric power. Produces 5000 gold per day and grants all Jurassica creatures +2 attack and +2 defense. The fossilized heart of the ancient supercontinent pulses with primordial energy.

dwelling1.name: Glider Nest
dwelling1.description: Allows recruitment of Ozimeks. Woven nests perched among the treetops where these small gliding reptiles roost.

dwelling2.name: Raptor Den
dwelling2.description: Allows recruitment of Raptors. A hidden cave system where swift predators lurk in the shadows.

dwelling3.name: Ceratopsian Pen
dwelling3.description: Allows recruitment of Triceratops. A reinforced enclosure built to contain these powerful horned beasts.

dwelling4.name: Plated Enclosure
dwelling4.description: Allows recruitment of Stegosaurus. A sturdy yard where armored herbivores graze among cycads and horsetails.

dwelling5.name: Pterosaur Roost
dwelling5.description: Allows recruitment of Pterodactyls. Towering cliff-face roosts where winged reptiles survey the land below.

dwelling6.name: Tidal Grotto
dwelling6.description: Allows recruitment of Elasmosaurus. A flooded sea cave connected to the deep ocean by ancient channels.

dwelling7.name: Primeval Throne
dwelling7.description: Allows recruitment of Tyrannosaurus Rex. A volcanic caldera serves as the lair of the king of all dinosaurs.

upgDwelling1.name: Volans Aerie
upgDwelling1.description: Allows recruitment of Ozimek Volans, the upgraded form of Ozimek. Enhanced nests with thermal updraft channels for true flight.

upgDwelling2.name: Predator Lair
upgDwelling2.description: Allows recruitment of Utahraptors, the upgraded form of Raptor. A larger, more fortified den for these fearsome hunters.

upgDwelling3.name: Armored Stockade
upgDwelling3.description: Allows recruitment of Torosaurus, the upgraded form of Triceratops. Reinforced pens for even mightier horned beasts.

upgDwelling4.name: Spike Yard
upgDwelling4.description: Allows recruitment of Kentrosaurus, the upgraded form of Stegosaurus. A yard bristling with sharpened stakes to match its spiny occupants.

upgDwelling5.name: Sky Citadel
upgDwelling5.description: Allows recruitment of Quetzalcoatlus, the upgraded form of Pterodactyl. A massive aerial fortress atop the highest peaks.

upgDwelling6.name: Abyssal Pool
upgDwelling6.description: Allows recruitment of Mosasaurus, the upgraded form of Elasmosaurus. A bottomless pool connected to the darkest ocean depths.

upgDwelling7.name: Extinction Arena
upgDwelling7.description: Allows recruitment of Giganotosaurus, the upgraded form of Tyrannosaurus Rex. A cataclysmic arena where only the most colossal predators survive.

special1.name: Tar Pits
special1.description: All Jurassica creatures gain +1 defense during siege battles. Bubbling pools of black tar form a natural barrier that toughens the resolve of defending dinosaurs.

special2.name: Amber Mine
special2.description: Produces 1 crystal per day. Ancient resin deposits are excavated and refined into precious crystal resources.

special3.name: Fossil Museum
special3.description: All visiting heroes gain 1000 experience points. A grand hall displaying the preserved remains of legendary creatures, inspiring all who walk its corridors.

special4.name: Primordial Spring
special4.description: Visiting heroes gain +2 spell power while stationed in town. A geothermal spring infused with raw magical energy from the planet's core.
